column1: #Text=Mubarak summoned by Egyptian prosecutors to face allegations of killings and corruption
#Text=was ousted as president of Egypt in February .
#Text=Image : Executive Office of the President of the United States .

#Text=, the Egyptian president ousted in February after massive demonstrations , has been summoned by officials in the country to face questions about corruption within his administration and allegations he ordered his forces to kill activists protesting against him .

#Text=The news came hours after Mubarak announced he would cooperate with the investigation into corruption within his regime , and said he would robustly defend himself against what he termed an " unjust " campaign of " distortions , lies and incitement " against him .

column1: #Text=He made the comments in his first appearance since he was ousted from office .
#Text=His two sons have also been summoned by Egyptian prosecutors to answer to allegations of embezzlement of public funds during Mubarak 's rule .

#Text=This afternoon , the former prime minister of Egypt , Ahmed Nazif , was taken into custody for 15 days as part of the corruption investigation , the Egyptian public prosecutor said in a statement .
#Text=Mubarak said he would not be returning to politics and he had left office in " the interest of the country " .

#Text=He said he would write to Egyptian officials to say he would cooperate with their investigation , and added the inquest would find his assets were " far from any allegations of corruption , " following which he would " legally pursue those who engaged in lies and distortions against me .

#Text= He said : " I have been in great pain because of the unjust campaigns and untrue allegations targeting myself and my family .

column1: #Text=They aim to tarnish my reputation and discredit my integrity , my stance , my political and military history during which I worked hard for Egypt and its people in peace and war .
